meanings.definition: A group of items wrapped or tied together for carrying
meanings.sent1: I carried a heavy pack on my back during the hike.
meanings.sent2: The pack of supplies was too bulky to fit in the small bag.
meanings.sent3: The pack of snacks was so big, it looked like a mini grocery store!
meanings.sent4: Her suitcase was like a pack of memories from all her travels.
meanings.sent5: The pack of books weighed me down like a ton of bricks.

meanings.definition: A group of animals, especially wolves or hounds, that hunt together
meanings.sent1: The wolf pack howled in unison under the full moon.
meanings.sent2: The pack of hounds chased after the scent of the fox.
meanings.sent3: The pack of wolves played a game of hide-and-seek in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The hunting pack moved swiftly through the dense woods.
meanings.sent5: The pack of wild dogs roamed freely in the wilderness.

meanings.definition: To fill a container tightly with items
meanings.sent1: I need to pack my suitcase for the trip tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She carefully packed the fragile items in bubble wrap.
meanings.sent3: He tried to pack all his clothes into a tiny backpack.
meanings.sent4: The students helped pack the boxes with school supplies.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to pack the ingredients neatly in the pantry.

meanings.definition: To compress something into a confined space
meanings.sent1: She had to pack her winter clothes into a small drawer.
meanings.sent2: He managed to pack all his belongings into a single suitcase.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to pack himself into a tiny car for the show.
meanings.sent4: The moving crew helped pack the furniture into the truck.
meanings.sent5: The artist had to pack all her paintings into a small portfolio.
